result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michele C Schacht

defendant.name: Schacht, Michele C
defendant.address: %Villa Inn, 1255 Whitewater Avenue, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

records.addlTxt: Arraignment
Treatment Letter

9:39 AM Court calls 21CF82, 21CF328 & 22CF36.  Defendant Michele C Schacht in court.  Attorney Andrew Robert Griggs in court for Michele C Schacht.  Attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Pack reviews stipulation and recommendation.  Parties acknowledge approval w/exception of length of conditional jail time.  Court questions defendant and reviews chgs and pens.  Defendant enters NC plea in Count 1, Case No. 21CF82.  Court finds victim rights compliant.  Court accepts plea and finds defendant Guilty in Count 1/Case No. 21CF82;  remaining counts in 21CF82 are DRI;  all counts in 21CF328 and 22CF36 are DRI.  Attorney Pack heard on sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Griggs heard.  Defendant makes statement.  Court heard and imposes sentence as follows:

21CF82 - Count 1
w/held sentence - 5 yrs probation

COP
6 mos DCJ w/h&t comm on or before July 15th at 6:00 pm  - release for any counseling and medical appointments
absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol unless prescribed by doctor
follow through on all treatment
AODA
any other counseling/treatment per agent
no contact w/victim
no violent or abusive contact w/anyone
court costs
DNA sample

jail credit held open if revoked

8:28 AM Defendant Michele C Schacht not in court.  Attorney Andrew Robert Griggs not in court.  Attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for State of Wisconsin. Possible global resolution to this case. Court will look for paperwork to be filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Letter from Atty Griggs

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

10:40 AM Defendant Michele C Schacht in court with attorney Andrew Robert Griggs.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $2500 PA bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
